resources.string:
Color Namer gives names to colors, letting you explore the named colorspace. Names are based on the results of the XKCD color survey. The most similar color from the survey results is displayed next to the color you picked.

 Color names were calculated from survey data by Randall Monroe, who writes the webcomic XKCD. He writes on his blog:

 "The RGB value for a name is based on the location in the RGB color space where there was the highest frequency of responses choosing that name. This was tricky to calculate. I tried simple geometric means (conceptually flawed), a brute force survey of all potential center points (too slow), and fitting kernel density functions (math is hard). In the end, I used the average of a bunch of runs of a stochastic hillclimbing algorithm. For mostly boring notes on my data handling for this list, see the comments at the bottom of the xkcd.com/color/rgb page."

 

About this app 
Version 2.2, March 2013 
This app was developed by Katie Dektar (dektar.com). Please give me feedback in the app store, or email me directly at katie.dektar@gmail.com 
The color name data was taken from the xkcd color survey.

Color Namer 2.2 
Color Namer can be used to name colors using the camera, browse colors by hue, search for colors by name, or look up specific colors by hex value. 

Naming Colors 
1. Use the camera option to determine colors in your environment! You can tap different spots on the screen for the color at that point, as well as pause the camera to look at one frame more closely. A share option is also available so that your friends can see too! 

2. In the Color Chooser, tap the color picker at the color of your choice. To show more colors, pinch your fingers across the color picker or move the slider to add or subtract the color blue. All colors in the rainbow can be created in this manner. 

3. Submit a specific hex color by clicking the Enter Hex button. This is a color of the form '#xxxxxx' or 'xxxxxx' where 'x' is a digit or a letter between a and f, inclusive, e.g. '#ac03ee' 

4. Find a random color using the Random button. 

Searching Colors 
Exploring the set of color names from the XKCD color survey can be pretty fun. Try searching for common colors like blue or red, or adjectives like bright - or explore less common trends. We recommend: 
berry, sea, dirty and dusty, ugly, poo and ish. 

Sharing Colors 
You can share colors with friends - sending a swatch of the color as well as the color name. From the camera, sharing sends a screenshot too.
Use the slider or pinch the color picker to add or subtract blue for all possible hex colors.
